did.unittitle: Westborough, Mass. Church of Christ records, 1724-1787.
did.abstract: The Church of Christ was gathered on October 28, 1724 with Ebenezer Parkman, who served the church until his death, as its minister. In 1825 the church reformed as the First Congregational Society. This collection contains digital surrogates and a microfilm copy of the record book for the Church of Christ.

Digital images were gifted to the Congregational Library & Archives for use in the New England's Hidden Histories project by Anthony T. Vaver, the local history librarian at the Westborough Public Library; Acc# 2018-07.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The town of Westborough was incorporated on November 19, 1717 and construction on the town's first meeting house completed in 1722. The Church of Christ was gathered on October 28, 1724 with Ebenezer Parkman as its minister. During the First Great Awakening, both George Whitefield and Johnathan Edwards preached at the Church of Christ. Construction began on a second meeting house in 1748, and the first service held there was on September 3, 1749. After 58 years as the church's minister, Ebenezer Parkman died on December 9, 1782. In 1825, shortly after the first train station opened in Westborough, the church reformed as the First Congregational Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains digital surrogates and a microfilm copy of the record book, which includes meeting minutes, records of votes, vital records such as marriage records, baptismal records, and records of dismissals and admissions, membership lists, and church covenants, for the Church of Christ in Westborough, Massachusetts.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: To access digital user's copies via online-interface, a java-enabled web browser is required. Internet Explorer 8.x and later, Firefox 5.x and later, Opera 12 and later, Safari 5.x and later, or any version of Google Chrome are recommended.
A microfilm reader is required in order to access microform materials. One microfilm reader is available to the public upon request.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional materials related to the Evangelical Church, a church that traces its history directly to the Church of Christ, can be found in the Westborough, Mass. Evangelical Church records, 1859, RG0999.
